result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: separation which contributes to improving photocatalytic CO 2 conversion efficiency.The present investigation is anticipated to provide a new way for fabricating highly efficient perovskite-based photocatalyst in solar-energy-driven applications.

were analyzed using a gas chromatograph (GC-2014c, SHIMADZU, Japan) with a flame ionization detector (FID) for CH 4 and CO detection and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) for H 2 and O detection.High purity N 2 (99.999) and H 2 (99.999) were used as carrier gas.The chromatographic column temperature was rised from to 170 C during 17 min for detection.Blank experiments were also carried out in the visible light without photocatalyst.

Photocatalytic CO 2 conversion to valuable fossil fuels has been demonstrated to be a promising approach to reduce emissions of CO 2 and produce renewable energy, which primarily depends on developing the high efficiency of charge separation photocatalysts.Herein, CsPbBr 3 , one typical kind of all-inorganic perovskite nanocrystal, is immobilized on monolayer MoS 2 nanosheets to construct a new and ideal CsPbBr 3 MoS 2 photocatalyst in the application of CO 2 photoreduction.In comparison with pure CsPbBr 3

a CEL-SPS 1000 (Beijing China Education Au-light Co., Ltd., China).Transient surface photovoltage (TPV) spectra were performed on a CEL-TPV2000 instrument (Beijing China Education Au-light Co., Ltd., China).The CO 2 temperature-programmed desorption (CO TPD) experiments of photocatalysts were performed on a DAS-7000 multifunction catalyst analysis system (China Hunan Huasi Technology Co., Ltd.). Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
